identificationModule.briefTitle: Assessment of Methadone Dose Taken Using Electrochemistry
identificationModule.officialTitle: Assessment of Methadone Dose Taken Using Electrochemistry

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Proof of concept: Pilot Study

A Pilot, proof of concept, observational study with a long-term goal to develop a minimally invasive wearable Remote Medication Monitor (RMM) that provides continuous, real-time data on methadone levels in interstitial fluid (ISF). An RMM could be used as a medication adherence monitor and would allow for the physician, counselor, patient, or family member to remotely verify that a physician-prescribed dose has been taken.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The investigator will conduct a non-randomized, non-blinded, feasibility study at a single center in the United States. The study will include up to 20 subjects of an equal number of male and female adults (ages 18-70) who have a prescription for methadone for chronic pain. In Aim 1, the investigator will determine if an RMM can assess the status of taking a prescribed dose of methadone, using biosamples (i.e., ISF, blood) collected from subjects and tested in a laboratory setup. Biosample collections and pharmacokinetic monitoring will take up to 6 consecutive hours. By completing this aim, the investigator will determine if a physician is able to recognize the peak and trough of a methadone dose using ex vivo Differential Pulse Voltammetry (DPV).

In Aim 2, the investigator will determine if an RMM can continuously assess the status of taking a prescribed dose of methadone over time, by inserting the intradermal microneedle sensing elements into the subjects' skin. The electronics for the RMM prototypes will consist of commercially available benchtop potentiostats like the PalmSens Sensit BT (https://www.palmsens.com/product/palmsens4/) or CH Instruments 660D (https://www.chinstruments.com/) and will not be in direct contact with the skin. Biosample collections (i.e., ISF, blood) and pharmacokinetic monitoring will occur over a 6-hour period. By completing this aim, the investigator will determine if a physician is able to recognize the pharmacokinetic profile of a taken dose of methadone. The physician will see a dosing curve display generated from intradermal microneedle sensing elements that are worn continuously on the skin. Completion of Aims 1-2 will require two separate visits.

armGroups.label: Visit Day 1
armGroups.description: AIM 1 : Determine if an RMM can assess the status of taking a prescribed dose of methadone. To complete this aim, the peak and trough concentrations of a witnessed methadone dose will be assessed in ISF collected through the surface of the skin using existing ISF extraction methods and assessed outside the body via differential pulse voltammetry (DPV). We hypothesize that the peak and trough blood samples will correlate with the level of methadone in collected ISF.
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Measurement of Methadone in the Interstitial Fluid (ISF) before and after prescribed dose taken ex vivo
Drug: Measurement of Methadone in ISF before and after taking prescribed dose

armGroups.label: Visit Day 2
armGroups.description: AIM 2 : Determine if an RMM can continuously assess the status of taking a prescribed dose of methadone over time. To complete this aim, the pharmacokinetic profile of a witnessed methadone dose will be assessed in ISF continuously from the surface of the skin using the RMM for up to 6 hours. We hypothesize that a clinician can recognize a dose taken from the continuous and real-time RMM measurements made in live ISF.
interventionNames: Device: Measurement of Methadone in the Interstitial Fluid before and after prescribed dose taken in vivo
Drug: Measurement of Methadone in ISF before and after taking prescribed dose

interventions.name: ISF extraction device 1
interventions.description: FDA approved microneedle attached to blotter paper tested for ability to extract 1ul of interstitial fluid

interventions.name: Measurement of Methadone in the Interstitial Fluid (ISF) before and after prescribed dose taken ex vivo
interventions.description: Measurement of Methadone and its metabolites in interstitial fluid with Liquid Chromatography - Mass Spectroscopy (LC-MS) and Electrochemical Assay

interventions.name: Measurement of Methadone in the Interstitial Fluid before and after prescribed dose taken in vivo
interventions.description: Measurement of Methadone and its metabolites in ISF with LC-MS and DPV
otherNames: In vivo Differential Pulse Voltammetery ( DPV )

interventions.name: Measurement of Methadone in ISF before and after taking prescribed dose
interventions.description: Measurement of methadone in ISF using DPV ex vivo versus in vivo . (Accuracy comparison - sensitivity, specificity, level of detection, and standard deviations )
otherNames: Comparing in vitro and in vivo approaches to determining a dose taken

interventions.name: ISF Extraction Device 2
interventions.description: 2 hour periods of continuous ISF collection for analysis

primaryOutcomes.measure: Methadone Concentration in ISF before and after a dose
primaryOutcomes.description: measure dermal interstitial fluid with LC-MS for methadone before and after a daily dose

primaryOutcomes.measure: Methadone Concentration in blood before and after a dose
primaryOutcomes.description: measure blood for methadone with LC-MS before and after a daily dose

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concentration of Methadone in ISF with LC-MS versus Electrochemical Assay
primaryOutcomes.description: measure ISF with two procedures (Liquid Chromatography - Mass Spectroscopy and Differential Pulse Voltammetry.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concentration of Methadone in blood with LC-MS versus Electrochemical Assay
primaryOutcomes.description: measure blood with two procedures (Liquid Chromatography - Mass Spectroscopy and Differential Pulse Voltammetry.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation of Methadone between ISF and Blood
primaryOutcomes.description: measure blood and ISF methadone with LC-MS and determine pearson correlation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation between DPV and LC-MS ISF Methadone
primaryOutcomes.description: measure ISF for methadone by LC-MS and DPV and determine Pearson correlation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation between DPV and LC-MS ISF EDDP
primaryOutcomes.description: measure ISF for EDDP by LC-MS and DPV and determine Pearson correlation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation between DPV and LC-MS blood EDDP
primaryOutcomes.description: measure blood for EDDP by LC-MS and DPV and determine Pearson correlation

primaryOutcomes.measure: EDDP concentration in ISF before and after daily dose of methadone
primaryOutcomes.description: measure ISF for EDDP by LC-MS before and after daily dose of methadone

primaryOutcomes.measure: EDDP concentration in blood before and after daily dose of methadone
primaryOutcomes.description: measure blood for EDDP by LC-MS before and after daily dose of methadone

primaryOutcomes.measure: EMDP concentration in ISF before and after daily dose of methadone
primaryOutcomes.description: measure EMDP in ISF before and after daily dose of methadone

primaryOutcomes.measure: EMDP concentration in blood before and after daily dose of methadone
primaryOutcomes.description: measure EMDP in blood by LC-MS before and after daily dose of methadone

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation of Methadone to Metabolite Ratio ( MMR ) between ISF and Blood using LC-MS
primaryOutcomes.description: Calculate methadone to EDDP ratio of ISF and Blood and determine Pearson Correlation using LC-MS

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pearson Correlation of Methadone to Metabolite Ratio ( MMR ) between ISF and Blood using DPV
primaryOutcomes.description: Calculate methadone to EDDP ratio of ISF and Blood and determine Pearson Correlation using DPV

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 18-70
* A prescription for methadone for chronic pain at a dose of 10mg or more for at least one week.
* Taking methadone as prescribed during the last 4 days before consent to participate in the study.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Age \<18 or \>70
* A condition preventing or complicating ISF collection
* dermatological (skin) condition
* immunodeficiency
* recent blood donation
* anemia
* end stage renal disease
* liver cirrhosis
* cancer
* congestive heart failure
* bleeding diathesis
* tuberculosis (TB)
* Any active severe depression
* suicidal ideation
* mania symptoms
* Pregnancy
* Intending to become pregnant during the course of the study
* Enrolled in a substance use disorder treatment program
* Under a conservatorship.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Chronic pain patients that have been prescribed at least 10mg of methadone per day.
